chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
A: list X
p: X -> Prop

Goal:
(forall x : X, dec (p x)) -> ~ (forall x : X, x el A -> ~ p x) -> exists x : X, x el A /\ p x

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
dec = fun X : Prop => {X} + {~ X} : Prop -> Type Arguments dec _%type_scope
list_forall_dec : forall (X : Type) (A : list X) (p : X -> Prop), (forall x : X, dec (p x)) -> dec (forall x : X, x el A -> p x)
list_exists_dec : forall (X : Type) (A : list X) (p : X -> Prop), (forall x : X, dec (p x)) -> dec (exists x : X, x el A /\ p x)
cfind : forall (A0 : list ?X) (p0 : ?X -> Prop), (forall x : ?X, dec (p0 x)) -> {x : ?X | x el A0 /\ p0 x} + {forall x : ?X, x el A0 -> ~ p0 x} where ?X : [X : Type A : list X p : X -> Prop |- Type]
map_ext_in_iff : map ?f ?l = map ?g ?l < -> (forall a : ?A, a el ?l -> ?f a = ?g a) where ?A : [X : Type A : list X p : X -> Prop |- Type] ?B : [X : Type A : list X p : X -> Prop |- Type] ?f : [X : Type A : list X p : X -> Prop |- ?A -> ?B] ?g : [X : Type A : list X p : X -> Prop |- ?A -> ?B] ?l : [X : Type A : list X p : X -> Prop |- list ?A]
Forall_forall : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l < -> (forall x : A, x el l -> P x)
RingMicromega.Psatz_ind : forall (C : Type) (P : RingMicromega.Psatz C -> Prop), (forall n : nat, P (RingMicromega.PsatzIn C n)) -> (forall p : RingMicromega.PolC C, P (RingMicromega.PsatzSquare p)) -> (forall (p : RingMicromega.PolC C) (p0 : RingMicromega.Psatz C), P p0 -> P (RingMicromega.PsatzMulC p p0)) -> (forall p : RingMicromega.Psatz C, P p -> forall p0 : RingMicromega.Psatz C, P p0 -> P (RingMicromega.PsatzMulE p p0)) ->...-> forall p : RingMicromega.Psatz C, P p
dec_DM_and : forall X Y : Prop, dec X -> dec Y -> ~ (X /\ Y) -> ~ X \/ ~ Y
dec_DM_impl : forall X Y : Prop, dec X -> dec Y -> ~ (X -> Y) -> X /\ ~ Y
Exists_exists : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Exists P l < -> (exists x : A, x el l /\ P x)
forallb_forall : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l : list A), forallb f l = true < -> (forall x : A, x el l -> f x = true)
Forall_Exists_neg : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall (fun x : A => ~ P x) l < -> ~ Exists P l
NoDup_sind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> SProp), P [] -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), ~ x el l -> NoDup l -> P l -> P (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, NoDup l -> P l
NoDup_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P [] -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), ~ x el l -> NoDup l -> P l -> P (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, NoDup l -> P l
dec_DN : forall X : Prop, dec X -> ~ ~ X -> X
notin_flat_map_Forall : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> list B) (x : B) (l : list A), ~ x el flat_map f l < -> Forall (fun y : A => ~ x el f y) l
ForallOrdPairs_In : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (l : list A), ForallOrdPairs R l -> forall x y : A, x el l -> y el l -> x = y \/ R x y \/ R y x
in_flat_map : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> list B) (l : list A) (y : B), y el flat_map f l < -> (exists x : A, x el l /\ y el f x)
find_some : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l : list A) (x : A), find f l = Some x -> x el l /\ f x = true
count_occ : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> list A -> A -> nat
remove : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> A -> list A -> list A
Refl.make_conj_in : forall (A : Type) (eval : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Refl.make_conj eval l -> forall p : A, p el l -> eval p
not_in_cons : forall (A : Type) (x a : A) (l : list A), ~ x el a :: l < -> x <> a /\ ~ x el l
prod_rect : forall (A B : Type) (P : A * B -> Type), (forall (a : A) (b : B), P (a, b)) -> forall p : A * B, P p
in_split_l : forall (A B : Type) (l : list (A * B)) (p : A * B), p el l -> fst p el fst (split l)
in_split_r : forall (A B : Type) (l : list (A * B)) (p : A * B), p el l -> snd p el snd (split l)
In_nth : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (x d : A), x el l -> exists n : nat, n < | l | /\ nth n l d = x
filter_In : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (x : A) (l : list A), x el filter f l < -> x el l /\ f x = true
fst = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (x, _) := p in x : forall A B : Type, A * B -> A Arguments fst {A B}%type_scope
nodup : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> list A -> list A
Dec_auto_not : forall (X : Prop) (d : dec X), ~ X -> ~ Dec X
